intro: Chondrosea burseriana, commonly known as the African snowball tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive white, spherical flower clusters that bloom in winter. The tree has a smooth, greyish bark and produces small, leathery leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils. The plant is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
